page.title: 15Crop Spraying at Kirkandrews
page.content: To prevent crops being attacked by insects or smothered by weeds, we use a crop sprayer on our farm. We use it twice a year on Barley, Turnips and Potatoes. We use Aldrin 30, Seritox and Embutox plus chemicals dissolved in water as our insecticides. The sprayer pump is driven by the tractor engine. It is then passed through the filters and the control valves to the nozzles which spray downwards on the crop. The spraying arms can be adjusted up and down so as to reduce waste spray. The spreader has two adjustable spout angles so that different types of fertiliser, such as pellets or powder, can be used. Barley can also be sown by the spreader.
